mainFeatures1: Payroll for small and medium businesses
mainFeatures2: Automated creation of documents and reports according to the schedule of business processes
mainFeatures3: Corporate or isolated method of accounting for multiple enterprises in a centralized database
mainFeatures4: Role model of user access to system resources and functions
accountantFeature1: Creation of vacancies and appointment of employees.
employeeFeature1: Viewing the personal card and personal payroll sheets.
administratorFeature1: Assignment of access rights to users.
accountantDetailFeature1: Creation of enterprises, determination of calculation parameters and accounting of wages. The number of enterprises is not limited.
accountantDetailFeature2: Creation of divisions, vacancies, appointment of employees to positions and definition of the Labor Remuneration Fund.
accountantDetailFeature3: Payroll is automatically calculated after each employee card or setup change event.
accountantDetailFeature4: After calculating the salary of employees, the calculation of payroll charges, the calculation of postings and the summary of salary information is automatically performed.
accountantDetailFeature5: The full result of the salary calculation for the enterprise is always relevant and does not require special actions from the accountant.
accountantDetailFeature6: The creation of accounting documents and periodic reports is performed automatically according to the schedule of business processes.
employeeDetailFeature1: Review of personal identity card, history of appointments and changes in terms of payment.
employeeDetailFeature2: Review and verification of personal data contained in the company file.
employeeDetailFeature3: Obtaining the balance of the number of vacation days, summaries of days of absence due to illness.
employeeDetailFeature4: Compiling applications for leave or dismissal.
employeeDetailFeature5: Notification of absence due to illness.
employeeDetailFeature6: Review of personal payroll sheets for the current and previous payment periods.
employeeDetailFeature7: Obtaining an explanation of the calculation by types of accruals and deductions and reports of accrued wages.
administratorDetailFeatures1: Manage users' work in corporate or isolated payroll environments for multiple enterprises in a centralized database.
administratorDetailFeatures2: Creation of a list of user roles according to the distribution of tasks between accounting participants.
administratorDetailFeatures3: By default, users are assigned roles of the standard types: 'Administrator', 'Accountant', 'Employee', depending on the method of user registration.
administratorDetailFeatures4: Roles created in the system by default, their functions and access parameters can be redefined by the Administrator in accordance with the system usage scenario.
administratorDetailFeatures5: Updating common dictionaries. Dictionaries containing legal norms are updated automatically.
CorporateStructureDescription1: Centralized accounting of enterprises with a single regulatory and reference subsystem.
CorporateStructureDescription2: An administrator or group of administrators keeps the local general purpose directories up to date.
CorporateStructureDescription3: Dictionaries containing legal regulations are updated automatically.
CorporateStructureDescription4: In this case, users' access to dictionaries is limited to 'read-only' mode.
CorporateStructureDescription5: System administration can be performed by employees of the organization or support specialists.
IndependentEnterprisesDescription1: Centralized accounting of independent enterprises with an isolated regulatory and reference subsystem.
IndependentEnterprisesDescription2: In this scenario, the administrator partially or fully transfers the support of local directories to an accountant or a group of accountants.
IndependentEnterprisesDescription3: Isolated dictionaries are filled out separately for each enterprise.
IndependentEnterprisesDescription4: The dictionaries containing legal norms are updated automatically.
IndependentEnterprisesDescription5: System administration can be performed by an employee of a service organization or support specialists.
SingleEnterpriseDescription2: The system is installed on the company's server independently or with the involvement of a support specialist.
SingleEnterpriseDescription3: The dictionaries containing legal norms are updated automatically. Local dictionaries are populated by users.
SingleEnterpriseDescription4: In this scenario, it is also possible to configure one user's access rights to all system functions or to distribute functions among a group of users.
SingleEnterpriseDescription5: Administrative functions can be performed by the user himself, one or more group users, or a support specialist.
post-work-sheet: Make changes to the Work Time Sheet and post the document
post-accrual-document: Calculate additional accruals and post document
send-application-fss: Send the Application to the Social Insurance Fund
post-payment-fss: Pay accruals by the Social Insurance Fund
welcome-new-user2: To start work, you need to complete the tasks listed below.
